title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Date: 2025-11-11 document summarizes work done create vdjmatchR repository, R package exposing Rust TCR matching functionality (derived vdjmatch-rs) via extendr.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Scaffolded new R package ~/develop/vdjmatchR. Embedded Rust crate (src/rust) core matching logic extendr wrappers. Added R convenience functions returning data.frames ergonomic usage. Implemented pkgdown documentation site configuration multiple vignettes. Included GitHub Actions workflow build deploy pkgdown site.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: DESCRIPTION — package metadata (updated vignettes/pkgdown). NAMESPACE — uses dynamic library; exports default pattern. R/match.R — high-level R helpers (data.frame results, filters). R/vdjdb.R — packaged DB paths, user DB configuration. R/RDatabase.R — roxygen topic RDatabase class. README.md — quickstart examples. .Rbuildignore, .gitignore — ignores incl. pkgdown artifacts. LICENSE, LICENSE.md — MIT license metadata. src/rust/Cargo.toml — staticlib crate dependencies (extendr-api, etc.). src/rust/src/lib.rs — extendr module exports. src/rust/src/{alignment,database,error,filtering,matching,scoring,sequence,utils}.rs — copied vdjmatch-rs. src/Makevars, src/Makevars.win — link flags via rextendr. src/entrypoint.c — minimal C stub (registration; extendr handles ). _pkgdown.yml — site configuration, navbar, reference groups. .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml — CI build deploy site. vignettes/getting-started.Rmd — intro vignette. vignettes/scoring--scope.Rmd — scoring tolerance. vignettes/batch-matching.Rmd — batch matching workflows. vignettes/database-management.Rmd — downloading filtering DB.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: File: src/rust/src/lib.rs new_from_file(path: &str) -> RDatabase new_from_vdjdb(use_fat_db: bool) -> RDatabase (disabled; instructs use new_from_file()) len(&self) -> i32 filter(&self, species: Option<String>, gene: Option<String>, min_vdjdb_score: i32) -> RDatabase filter_by_epitope_size(&self, min_size: i32) -> RDatabase match_tcr(db, cdr3, v_segment, j_segment, scope, top_n) -> List (single clonotype) match_tcr_many(db, cdr3[], v_segment[], j_segment[], scope, top_n) -> List (batch) vdjdb_ensure(use_fat_db: bool) -> String (disabled; automatic download supported) vdjdb_update() -> () (disabled; automatic update supported) Notes - Scoring currently uses simple mismatch approach defined copied matching/scoring modules. - scope parsing supports "s,,d,t" "s,id,t" formats; "0,0,0,0" means exact. - Batch results include query_index (1-based R) query metadata columns.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Files: R/match.R, R/vdjdb.R match_tcr_df(db, cdr3, v_segment = "", j_segment = "", scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 0) → data.frame match_tcr_many_df(db, cdr3[], v_segment[], j_segment[], scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 0) → data.frame filter_db(db, species = NULL, gene = NULL, min_vdjdb_score = 0) → RDatabase filter_db_by_epitope_size(db, min_size = 1) → RDatabase vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) → packaged TSV(.gz) path (slim/full) vdjdb_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) → uses user-specified path set via vdjdb_set_user_db(), else packaged vdjdb_set_user_db(path, use_fat_db = FALSE) → set user-supplied DB file session vdjdb_update_latest()/vdjdb_download()/vdjdb_update_all() → disabled (network); instructs use vdjdb_set_user_db()

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Requirements - Rust ≥ 1.70 cargo - R toolchain rextendr (compile/link flags) Install steps - R: install.packages("rextendr") - shell package root: R CMD INSTALL .

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Local build: R, run roxygen2::roxygenise(); pkgdown::build_site(). CI deploy: GitHub Actions builds docs/ publishes Pages (enable Pages repo).

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Getting started: walkthrough install, download, filtering, matching. Scoring scope: guidance scope interpreting scores. Batch matching: efficient multi-query usage. Database management: ensuring/updating VDJdb filtering strategies.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: src/entrypoint.c contains dummy symbol avoid conflicting extendr’s auto-registration; Rust side provides R_init_* hook. Automatic download disabled. package use ~/.vdjmatch perform network /O. Slim full VDJdb samples bundled (gzipped) inst/extdata/vdjdb.slim.txt.gz inst/extdata/vdjdb.txt.gz immediate use; vdjdb_packaged_path() locates (fallback uncompressed filenames present). Core Rust modules currently copied vdjmatch-rs keep repo self-contained.

title: vdjmatchR Implementation Summary
text: Replace placeholder URLs DESCRIPTION _pkgdown.yml real GitHub org/repo. Refactor depend library crate version vdjmatch-rs avoid code duplication (workspace git dependency). Add tests (R Rust) CI build checks. Add R-friendly result shaping (e.g., tibble, factor levels segments). Expose additional configuration knobs (e.g., scoring mode toggle) R API.

title: Batch matching clonotypes
code: library(vdjmatchR) path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(FALSE) db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path) fdb <- filter_db(db, species = "HomoSapiens", gene = "TRB", min_vdjdb_score = 2)

title: Batch matching clonotypes
code: cdr3s <- c("CASSLGQAYEQYF", "CASSIRSSYEQYF", "CASSPGQGYEQYF") vs    <- c("TRBV12-3",      "TRBV7-9",       "TRBV20-1") js    <- c("TRBJ2-7",       "TRBJ2-7",       "TRBJ2-5")

title: Batch matching clonotypes
text: result row includes 1-based query_index maps back input vectors, along query clonotype hit columns.
code: res <- match_tcr_many_df(fdb, cdr3s, vs, js, scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 3) head(res)

title: Batch matching clonotypes
text: Ensure three input vectors equal length. Use top_n cap returned hits per query manageable size. Pre-filter database reduce compute noise.

title: Database management and filtering
code: library(vdjmatchR) # Use the slim VDJdb bundled with the package path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = FALSE)  # Optionally update to the latest slim/full VDJdb into the package's extdata # path <- vdjdb_update_latest(use_fat_db = FALSE)  # Or use the full ("fat") VDJdb bundled with the package # path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = TRUE)

title: Database management and filtering
code: db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path) db$len()

what: Filter by species, gene, and VDJdb score
title: Database management and filtering
code: # Human TRB, minimum VDJdb score 2 fdb <- filter_db(db, species = "HomoSapiens", gene = "TRB", min_vdjdb_score = 2)

title: Database management and filtering
code: # Keep epitopes with at least 5 unique CDR3 entries fdb2 <- filter_db_by_epitope_size(fdb, min_size = 5)

title: Database management and filtering
code: # Tell vdjmatchR where your own VDJdb file is for this session vdjdb_set_user_db("/path/to/vdjdb.txt.gz", use_fat_db = TRUE) path <- vdjdb_path(use_fat_db = TRUE)

title: Database management and filtering
text: Record file path used (vdjdb_path()) include analysis metadata. Consider snapshotting TSV file alongside project long-term reproducibility.

title: Getting started with vdjmatchR
text: Install Rust (>= 1.70) https://rustup.rs. R, install helper package: Build install package (repo root):
code: install.packages("rextendr") # in a shell R CMD INSTALL .

title: Getting started with vdjmatchR
code: library(vdjmatchR)  # Use the packaged slim VDJdb bundled with the package path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path)  # Optionally filter to human TRB with min score >= 2 fdb <- filter_db(db, species = "HomoSapiens", gene = "TRB", min_vdjdb_score = 2)  # Match a single clonotype, return a data.frame df <- match_tcr_df(   fdb,   cdr3 = "CASSLGQAYEQYF",   v_segment = "TRBV12-3",   j_segment = "TRBJ2-7",   scope = "0,0,0,0",   top_n = 5 ) print(df)  # Optionally, point to your own VDJdb file for this session # vdjdb_set_user_db("/path/to/vdjdb.slim.txt.gz", use_fat_db = FALSE) # db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(new_path)  # Batch matching of multiple clonotypes cdr3s <- c("CASSLGQAYEQYF", "CASSIRSSYEQYF") vs    <- c("TRBV12-3",      "TRBV7-9") js    <- c("TRBJ2-7",       "TRBJ2-7") res_many <- match_tcr_many_df(fdb, cdr3s, vs, js, scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 3) head(res_many)

title: Getting started with vdjmatchR
text: scope argument controls fuzzy matching tolerance using format "s,,d,t" (substitutions, insertions, deletions, total) "s,id,t" insertions deletions share limit. Use "0,0,0,0" exact matching.
code: # Allow up to 2 substitutions and 1 insertion/deletion, total up to 3 edits scope <- "2,1,2,3"

title: Getting started with vdjmatchR
text: Pre-filter database (species/gene/score) speed matching. Use top_n cap returned hits per query. large batches, prefer match_tcr_many_df().

title: Getting started with vdjmatchR
text: Document database version filters used analysis. Store VDJdb file path used (vdjdb_path()) project metadata.

title: Scoring and search scope
text: scope uses format "s,,d,t" (substitutions, insertions, deletions, maximum total edits) "s,id,t" insertions deletions share limit. example: Increasing tolerance typically increases number hits may dilute specificity results. Use top_n constrain result size per query.
code: # Exact matching only scope <- "0,0,0,0"  # Allow up to 2 substitutions, 1 insertion, 2 deletions, 3 edits total scope <- "2,1,2,3"

title: Scoring and search scope
text: current R interface returns per-hit score plus cdr3_score, v_score, j_score, edit_distance. default, scoring based simple mismatch counts pairwise alignment CDR3 sequences. Higher better scores shown, lower better edit_distance.
code: library(vdjmatchR) path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(FALSE) db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path) fdb <- filter_db(db, species = "HomoSapiens", gene = "TRB", min_vdjdb_score = 2)  # Strict vs relaxed scope comparison res_strict  <- match_tcr_df(fdb, "CASSLGQAYEQYF", "TRBV12-3", "TRBJ2-7", scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 5) res_relaxed <- match_tcr_df(fdb, "CASSLGQAYEQYF", "TRBV12-3", "TRBJ2-7", scope = "2,1,2,3", top_n = 5)

title: Scoring and search scope
text: Start exact ("0,0,0,0"), relax needed. exploratory searches, try modest tolerance "1,1,1,2". Use database filters (species/gene/score) broadening scope.

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: R interface Rust implementation TCR sequence matching (derived vdjmatch-rs), built via extendr.

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: Ships core matching logic Rust performance. Exposes R API using extendr. Designed work VDJdb-formatted TSVs (slim full).

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: Website: https://furlan-lab.github.io/vdjmatchR/ Reference topics vignettes available site.

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: Ensure Rust (>= 1.70) R toolchain installed. R, install rextendr aid linking (optional recommended): install.packages("rextendr") Build + install package package root: R CMD INSTALL .

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
code: library(vdjmatchR)  # Use the packaged slim VDJdb (bundled with the package) path <- vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path)  # Optionally update the packaged database into the package's extdata and use it # updated_path <- vdjdb_update_latest(use_fat_db = FALSE) # db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(updated_path)  # Or point to your own database file for this session # vdjdb_set_user_db("/path/to/vdjdb.slim.txt.gz", use_fat_db = FALSE) # path <- vdjdb_path(FALSE) # db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path)  # Or use the packaged full ("fat") VDJdb # path_full <- vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = TRUE) # db <- RDatabase$new_from_file(path_full)  # Filter for human TRB and higher-confidence entries fdb <- filter_db(db, species = "HomoSapiens", gene = "TRB", min_vdjdb_score = 2)  # Match a single clonotype; get a data.frame df <- match_tcr_df(fdb, cdr3 = "CASSLGQAYEQYF", v_segment = "TRBV12-3", j_segment = "TRBJ2-7", scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 5) print(df)  # Batch match: vectors of clonotypes cdr3s <- c("CASSLGQAYEQYF", "CASSIRSSYEQYF") vs    <- c("TRBV12-3", "TRBV7-9") js    <- c("TRBJ2-7",  "TRBJ2-7") res_many <- match_tcr_many_df(fdb, cdr3s, vs, js, scope = "0,0,0,0", top_n = 3) head(res_many)

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: RDatabase$new_from_file(path) RDatabase$len() RDatabase$filter(species = NULL, gene = NULL, min_vdjdb_score = 0) RDatabase$filter_by_epitope_size(min_size = 1) match_tcr(db, cdr3, v_segment, j_segment, scope, top_n) → list match_tcr_df(...) → data.frame match_tcr_many(db, cdr3, v_segment, j_segment, scope, top_n) → list match_tcr_many_df(...) → data.frame vdjdb_packaged_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) / vdjdb_path(use_fat_db = FALSE) vdjdb_set_user_db(path, use_fat_db = FALSE) (configure DB file)

title: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust)
text: Results returned data.frames via R wrappers convenience; core Rust functions return plain lists flexibility. Use scope like "0,0,0,0" exact e.g. "2,1,2,3" controlled fuzzy matching. guided walkthrough, see Getting started vignette: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd.

what: RDatabase: Handle to a loaded VDJdb — RDatabase
title: RDatabase: Handle to a loaded VDJdb — RDatabase
text: RDatabase object provided Rust backend (via extendr) holds -memory VDJdb table exposes methods filtering. Methods include: new_from_file(path) new_from_vdjdb(use_fat_db = FALSE) len() filter(species = NULL, gene = NULL, min_vdjdb_score = 0) filter_by_epitope_size(min_size = 1) See also: match_tcr_df, match_tcr_many_df, vdjdb_download.

what: vdjmatchR: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust) — vdjmatchR-package
title: vdjmatchR: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust) — vdjmatchR-package
text: R bindings query TCR sequences using Rust implementation derived vdjmatch-rs, via extendr. Provides fast TCR matching VDJdb-formatted databases using Rust engine exposed via extendr. Bundles slim/full sample databases supports using user-supplied database files.

title: vdjmatchR: R Interface to VDJmatch (Rust) — vdjmatchR-package
text: Maintainer: vdjmatch Authors @example.com
